alert.note: Alert for Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 24 at 9:56PM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLASH FLOODING POSSIBLE BY AT LEAST TUESDAY NIGHT... The active South Pacific Convergence Zone (SPCZ) just north of the main Samoa Islands is drifting southward, moving across the territory by at least Tuesday Night. The SPCZ passage will increase the potential for heavy rainfall across American Samoa. The rainfall duration and intensity is likely to produce flooding impacts by Tuesday Night, lasting through at least Thursday. Please keep up to date with the latest forecast information through our website (weather.gov/ppg), local media, social media, or NOAA Weather Radio broadcats. An updated outlook will be issued by 10 AM SST Tuesday, or sooner if necessary.

area.areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
